item.title: 今年夏天外国游客不去美国，零售旅游业出现短缺
item.description: 我是驻纽约的美国经济记者奥古斯塔-萨拉瓦。今天我们关注零售旅游业。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Augusta Saraiva, a US economy reporter in New York. Today we’re looking at retail tourism. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: Meta 引发人工智能人才 "淘金热"，以 "理性 "赢得竞争
item.description: 欢迎收看《深度科技》（Tech In Depth），这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，库尔特-瓦格纳（Kurt Wagner）想知道，大型科技公司花费数百万美元聘请人工智能研究人员究竟有多理性。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Kurt Wagner wonders just how rational it is for Big Tech companies to spend millions to hire artificial intelligence researchers.】

item.title: 土耳其中央银行降息幅度超出预期
item.description: 土耳其央行自 3 月份以来首次大幅降息，恢复了因反对派重要人物被捕而引发的政治危机所导致的降息周期。【原文：Turkey’s central bank delivered a sizable interest-rate cut for the first time since March, resuming a reduction cycle that was derailed by a political crisis stemming from the arrest of a leading opposition figure.】

item.title: 乌克兰央行维持利率不变，政府寻求更多 IMF 援助
item.description: 在乌克兰政府准备与国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）进行新的贷款谈判之际，乌克兰中央银行保持基准利率稳定，而最近针对反腐机构的行动加剧了捐助方的担忧。【原文：Ukraine’s central bank held its benchmark interest rate steady as the government prepares for new loan talks with the International Monetary Fund, with recent moves against anti-corruption agencies fueling donor concerns.】

item.title: 反对特朗普关税的法庭案件下一步将如何发展？
item.description: 自美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）宣布8月1日是达成协议或面临单边关税的最后期限以来，金融市场、海关合规办公室和政府贸易部门的日历上已经连续几周标注了8月1日星期五。【原文：Friday Aug. 1 has been marked on calendars across financial markets, customs compliance offices and government trade departments for weeks since US President Donald Trump declared it the final deadline to do a deal or face his unilateral tariffs.】

item.title: 凯雷收购农场贷款，为行业困境中的亏损套期保值
item.description: Carlyle Group Inc. 将从 FarmOp Capital 购买 2.5 亿美元的贷款，FarmOp Capital 是一家帮助农民应对农业季节性资金流并抵御近期农业破产浪潮的贷款机构。【原文：Carlyle Group Inc. is purchasing $250 million of loans from FarmOp Capital, a lend that helps farmers deal with the seasonal flow of funds in agriculture and fend off the recent wave of bankruptcies that have hit the industry.】

item.title: ArcLight 押注约 50 亿美元新建燃气发电厂
item.description: ArcLight Capital Partners 收购了电力开发商 Advanced Power，计划在美国建设 20 千兆瓦的天然气发电厂，主要为电力需求量大的数据中心供电。该公司表示，未来 5 年将投资约 50 亿美元。【原文：ArcLight Capital Partners acquired electricity developer Advanced Power with a plan to build 20 gigawatts of natural gas-fired plants in the US mainly to feed power-hungry data centers. It says it may invest about $5 billion over the next 5 years.】

item.title: 亚马逊为 Prime Day 购物者提供了更多浏览时间。许多人去了沃尔玛
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）的高管们将今年夏季 Prime Day 促销活动的时间延长了一倍，以便顾客有更多的时间浏览大量的优惠和折扣信息。但这样做也有弊端。随着物价上涨成为人们最关心的问题，购物者们纷纷上网比较各种优惠，他们的大量资金转而流向了沃尔玛公司（Walmart Inc.【原文：Amazon.com Inc. executives doubled the length of their summer Prime Day sale this year to give customers extra time to browse the vast selection of deals and discounts. There was a downside. With rising prices top of mind, shoppers surfed the web comparing deals, and a lot of their dollars went to Walmart Inc. instead.】

item.title: 欧洲央行将维持利率不变
item.description: 法兰克福欧洲中央银行总部。摄影师：Liesa Johannssen/Bloomberg【原文：The ECB headquarters in Frankfurt. Photographer: Liesa Johannssen/Bloomberg】

item.title: 欧洲顶级美元债券在避险竞赛中超越国债
item.description: 欧洲一些最大公共部门发行的美元债券目前的收益率低于可比的美国国债；这一不寻常的转变凸显出国债的吸引力正在减弱。【原文：Dollar bonds from some of Europe’s biggest public-sector issuers are now trading at yields below comparable US government debt — an unusual turn that underscores the diminishing appeal of Treasuries.】

item.title: 贸易协议希望减弱避险资产需求，国债下跌
item.description: 美国国债连续第二天下跌，原因是投资者对美国在与日本达成协议后将达成更多贸易协议持乐观态度，从而减少了对避险资产的投资。【原文：US Treasuries fell for a second day as investors trimmed exposure to haven assets on optimism that the US will reach more trade deals after clinching a pact with Japan.】

item.title: 英国 Actis 公司计划进军东南亚清洁能源领域
item.description: 专门从事可持续基础设施建设的英国资产管理公司 Actis GP LLP 计划在未来两年内将东南亚可再生能源领域的投资翻一番，投资额高达 5 亿美元。【原文：UK asset manager Actis GP LLP, which specializes in sustainable infrastructure, plans to double investment in Southeast Asia’s renewable sector with a spend of up to $500 million over the next two years.】

item.title: 据说 Torrent 正在商谈以 10 亿美元收购 L&T 的电力部门
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Torrent Power Ltd. 正在洽谈以约 10 亿美元（包括债务）的价格收购 Larsen & Toubro Ltd. 的热力业务部门。【原文：Torrent Power Ltd. is in talks to buy the thermal business unit of Larsen & Toubro Ltd. for about $1 billion including debt, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 欧洲需求改善，Cemex 净收入超出预期
item.description: Cemex SAB 的盈利超出预期，因为这家墨西哥水泥生产商受益于欧洲的反弹，缓解了美国的疲软表现。【原文：Cemex SAB’s earnings surpassed expectations as the Mexican cement maker benefited from a rebound in Europe that cushioned a weaker performance in the US.】

item.title: 卢旺达卡加梅任命贾斯汀-恩森吉尤姆瓦为新总理
item.description: 卢旺达总统保罗-卡加梅任命贾斯汀-恩森吉尤姆瓦（Justin Nsengiyumva）为新总理。【原文：Rwandan President Paul Kagame appointed Justin Nsengiyumva as the nation’s new prime minister, according to an announcement on the government communication service’s X account.】

item.title: 游客驯服他们的购物狂方式，如果他们来美国的话
item.description:
一些游客正在远离度假热点，而另一些游客则在重新考虑他们的预算。【原文：

Some travelers are staying away from vacation hotspots, while others are rethinking their budgets. 

】

item.title: 印度采取行动保护电网免受太阳能设备恶意软件的侵害
item.description: 印度发布了保护太阳能发电设备免受潜在网络攻击的指导方针，以回应业界对中国制造的进口部件可能给电网带来风险的担忧。【原文：India issued guidelines to protect solar power equipment from potential cyberattacks, responding to industry concerns that imported China-made parts may be putting the grid at risk.】

item.title: 华尔街正在为这波史诗般的股市反弹套期保值
item.description:
交易员称，针对股市暴跌的保险很便宜。【原文：

Insurance against a stock market swoon is cheap, traders say. 

】

item.title: Goldman’s Trading Desk Touts Cheap Hedges Against S&P 500 Slide
item.description: Trading desks at firms including Goldman Sachs Group Inc. and Citadel Securities are telling clients to buy cheap hedges against potential losses in US stocks as a slew of risks loom over the market’s record advance.

item.title: 英国央行调查显示四月美元兑人民币交易波动剧增
item.description: 英格兰银行的数据显示，在四月的市场波动中，伦敦人民币对美元的交易量飙升，超过了其他主要货币对的增幅。【原文：The amount of Chinese yuan traded versus the US dollar soared in London during April’s market ructions, outstripping the increase for other major currency pairs, according to Bank of England data.】

item.title: Pakistan Army Intelligence Officer Meets FX Body as Rupee Falls
item.description: 本周，巴基斯坦的一些私营外汇公司与一个情报部门的负责人会面，讨论当地卢比暴跌的问题。【原文：A group of private foreign exchange companies in Pakistan met with the head of an intelligence department this week to discuss the local rupee’s slump.】

item.title: 瑞银放弃贝莱德阿拉丁平台以削减基金单位成本
item.description: 瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）结束了与贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：UBS Group AG has ended a multimillion dollar contract with BlackRock Inc.’s Aladdin technology platform that it inherited from Credit Suisse, as the Swiss bank continues to integrate its former rival’s asset management division.】

item.title: 加纳启动缩短采矿租赁期限的进程
item.description: 非洲最大的黄金生产国加纳正在审查其采矿法，以缩短颁发许可证的期限。【原文：Ghana, Africa’s biggest gold producer, is reviewing its mining laws to reduce the duration of licenses it grants.】

item.title: 英特尔首席执行官需要一条盈利之路来赢得股票怀疑论者的支持
item.description: 今年 4 月，英特尔公司新上任的首席执行官陈立武在其首次财报电话会议上告诉投资者，扭转这家陷入困境的芯片制造商的局面需要时间。那是三个月前的事了，现在投资者已经失去了耐心。【原文：Back in April, Intel Corp.’s newly appointed Chief Executive Officer Lip-Bu Tan told investors on his inaugural earnings call that turning around the troubled chipmaker would take time. That was three months ago — and they’re already losing patience.】

item.title: 初创公司接近利用压裂技术储存核废料
item.description:
深部隔离公司筹集了 3300 万美元，用于对其放射性物质地下储藏系统进行关键测试。【原文：

Deep Isolation raised $33 million to conduct a key test of its system to stash radioactive material underground.

】

item.title: 马来西亚在与美国的贸易谈判中寻求低于 20% 的关税
item.description: 马来西亚投资、贸易和工业部长扎弗鲁尔-阿齐兹（Zafrul Aziz）表示，马来西亚正在寻求将美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）威胁征收的关税降至20%以下，并对在8月1日最后期限前达成协议表示乐观。【原文：Malaysia is seeking to lower US tariffs threatened by President Donald Trump to less than 20% and is optimistic of reaching a deal ahead of the Aug. 1 deadline, according to Investment, Trade and Industry Minister Zafrul Aziz.】

item.title: 索马里国家调查在其沿海扣押的与土耳其有关的货物
item.description: 索马里半自治的邦特兰地区承认，它扣留了一艘满载军事装备的船只，直到查明货物的归属。【原文：Somalia’s semi-autonomous Puntland region acknowledged it’s holding a vessel full of military equipment until it can work out who the cargo belongs to.】

item.title: 贝莱德私募基金面临主要投资者 Arch 的退出企图
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：A key investor in BlackRock Inc.’s private funds is looking to cut its stakes following disappointing performance and senior executive departures at the US asset manager, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 英国企业削减工作岗位和新订单，经济增长举步维艰
item.description: 一项受到密切关注的调查显示，由于工党政府首份预算案的影响以及全球经济不景气的背景，促使企业削减工作岗位和新订单，英国私营部门在七月份失去了发展势头。【原文：Britain’s private sector lost momentum in July as the fallout from the Labour government’s first budget and a febrile global backdrop prompted firms to cut jobs and new orders, according to a closely watched survey.】

item.title: 土耳其税收冲击后，特斯拉在主要市场面临新的挫折
item.description: 土耳其是特斯拉公司增长最快的市场之一，该公司出人意料地提高了税收，这可能会危及特斯拉公司利用土耳其市场的增长抵消欧洲市场销售下滑的努力。【原文：Tesla Inc.’s efforts to offset slumping European sales with gains in Turkey may be at risk after a surprise tax hike in one of the automaker’s fastest-growing markets.】
